context: While <b7_0>the <a3_0>Armenian Apostolic Church<b7_0/><a3_0/> remains the most prominent church in the Armenian community throughout the world, Armenians (especially in the diaspora) subscribe to any number of other Christian denominations. These include the <a0_0>Armenian Catholic Church<a0_0/> (which follows <b6_0>its own liturgy<b6_0/> but recognizes <b4_0>the Roman Catholic Pope<b4_0/>), the <a1_0>Armenian Evangelical Church<a1_0/>, which started <b5_0>as a reformation in the Mother church but later broke away<b5_0/>, and the <a2_0>Armenian Brotherhood Church<a2_0/>, which was born in <b8_0>the Armenian Evangelical Church<b8_0/>, but later broke apart from it. There are other numerous Armenian churches belonging to Protestant denominations of all kinds.
